query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
1 ‘Al Padre, al Figlio, a lo Spirito Santo’, 2 cominciò, ‘gloria!’, tutto ’l paradiso, 3 sì che m’inebrïava il dolce canto.
query.result:
**English:**
1 ‘To the Father, to the Son, to the Holy Spirit’, 2 began, ‘glory!’, all of paradise, 3 so that the sweet song intoxicated me.
**Malay:**
1 ‘Kepada Bapa, kepada Anak, kepada Roh Kudus’, 2 mulailah, ‘kemuliaan!’, seluruh surga, 3 sehingga nyanyian yang merdu itu memabukkan aku.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
4 Ciò ch’io vedeva mi sembiava un riso 5 de l’universo; per che mia ebbrezza 6 intrava per l’udire e per lo viso.
query.result:
**English:**
4 What I saw seemed to me a smile 5 of the universe; for my intoxication 6 entered through my hearing and through my sight.
**Malay:**
4 Apa yang kulihat tampak bagiku sebagai senyuman 5 alam semesta; karena kemabukanku 6 masuk melalui pendengaranku dan melalui penglihatanku.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
7 Oh gioia! oh ineffabile allegrezza! 8 oh vita intègra d’amore e di pace! 9 oh sanza brama sicura ricchezza!
10 Dinanzi a li occhi miei le quattro face 11 stavano accese, e quella che pria venne 12 incominciò a farsi più vivace,
13 e tal ne la sembianza sua divenne, 14 qual diverrebbe Iove, s’elli e Marte 15 fossero augelli e cambiassersi penne.
query.result:
**English:**
7 Oh joy! Oh ineffable gladness! 8 Oh life, whole with love and peace! 9 Oh secure wealth without desire!
10 Before my eyes the four torches 11 stood alight, and the one that came first 12 began to grow brighter,
13 and in its appearance it became 14 such as Jove would become, if he and Mars 15 were birds and exchanged their feathers.
**Malay:**
7 Oh kegembiraan! Oh kegembiraan yang tak terlukiskan! 8 Oh kehidupan yang utuh dengan cinta dan kedamaian! 9 Oh kekayaan yang aman tanpa keinginan!
10 Di hadapan mataku keempat obor 11 berdiri menyala, dan yang datang lebih dulu 12 mulai menjadi lebih terang,
13 dan dalam penampilannya menjadi 14 seperti yang akan terjadi pada Yupiter, jika dia dan Mars 15 adalah burung dan bertukar bulu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
16 La provedenza, che quivi comparte 17 vice e officio, nel beato coro 18 silenzio posto avea da ogne parte,
19 quand’ ïo udi’: «Se io mi trascoloro, 20 non ti maravigliar, ché, dicend’ io, 21 vedrai trascolorar tutti costoro.
query.result:
**English:**
16 Providence, which here distributes 17 office and duty, had imposed 18 silence on every side in the blessed choir,
19 when I heard: "If I change color, 20 do not be amazed, for," I said, 21 "you will see all these others change color.
**Malay:**
16 Pemeliharaan, yang di sini membagi-bagikan 17 tugas dan jabatan, di dalam paduan suara yang diberkati 18 telah menaruh kesunyian di setiap sisi,
19 ketika aku mendengar: "Jika aku berubah warna, 20 janganlah heran, karena," kataku, 21 "kamu akan melihat semua yang lain ini berubah warna.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
22 Quelli ch’usurpa in terra il luogo mio, 23 il luogo mio, il luogo mio, che vaca 24 ne la presenza del Figliuol di Dio,
25 fatt’ ha del cimitero mio cloaca 26 del sangue e de la puzza; onde ’l perverso 27 che cadde di qua sù, là giù si placa».
query.result:
**English:**
22 Those who usurp my place on earth, 23 my place, my place, which is empty 24 in the presence of the Son of God,
25 have made my cemetery a sewer 26 of blood and stench; so the perverse one 27 who fell from up here is appeased down there.
**Malay:**
22 Mereka yang merampas tempatku di bumi, 23 tempatku, tempatku, yang kosong 24 di hadapan Putra Tuhan,
25 telah menjadikan kuburanku sebagai selokan 26 darah dan bau busuk; sehingga si jahat 27 yang jatuh dari atas sini, di bawah sana menjadi tenang.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
28 Di quel color che per lo sole avverso 29 nube dipigne da sera e da mane, 30 vid’ ïo allora tutto ’l ciel cosperso.
query.result:
**English:**
28 In that color that the sun opposed 29 paints clouds at evening and at morning, 30 I saw then all the sky covered.
**Malay:**
28 Dalam warna itu yang matahari yang berlawanan 29 awan yang dicat dari senja dan pagi, 30 kulihat saat itu seluruh langit tertutup.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
31 E come donna onesta che permane 32 di sé sicura, e per l’altrui fallanza, 33 pur ascoltando, timida si fane,
34 così Beatrice trasmutò sembianza; 35 e tale eclissi credo che ’n ciel fue 36 quando patì la supprema possanza.
query.result:
**English:**
31 And like a virtuous woman who remains 32 self-assured, and because of another's failing, 33 even though listening, becomes timid,
34 so Beatrice changed countenance; 35 and I believe that such an eclipse occurred in heaven 36 when the supreme power suffered.
**Malay:**
31 Dan seperti wanita berbudi luhur yang tetap 32 yakin pada dirinya sendiri, dan karena kegagalan orang lain, 33 meskipun mendengarkan, menjadi pemalu,
34 demikianlah Beatrice mengubah raut wajahnya; 35 dan aku percaya gerhana seperti itu terjadi di langit 36 ketika kekuatan tertinggi menderita.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
37 Poi procedetter le parole sue 38 con voce tanto da sé trasmutata, 39 che la sembianza non si mutò piùe:
40 «Non fu la sposa di Cristo allevata 41 del sangue mio, di Lin, di quel di Cleto, 42 per essere ad acquisto d’oro usata;
43 ma per acquisto d’esto viver lieto 44 e Sisto e Pïo e Calisto e Urbano 45 sparser lo sangue dopo molto fleto.
query.result:
**English:**
37 Then his words continued 38 in a voice so changed from itself 39 that his appearance did not change any more:
40 "Christ's bride was not brought up 41 by my blood, by Linus's, by Cletus's, 42 to be used for the acquisition of gold;
43 but for the acquisition of this joyful life 44 Sixtus and Pius and Callistus and Urban 45 shed their blood after much weeping.
**Malay:**
37 Kemudian perkataannya berlanjut 38 dengan suara yang sangat berubah dari dirinya sendiri, 39 sehingga penampilannya tidak berubah lagi:
40 "Pengantin Kristus tidak dibesarkan 41 oleh darahku, oleh Linus, oleh Cletus, 42 untuk digunakan untuk mendapatkan emas;
43 tetapi untuk mendapatkan kehidupan yang menyenangkan ini 44 Sixtus dan Pius dan Callistus dan Urban 45 menumpahkan darah mereka setelah banyak menangis.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
55 In vesta di pastor lupi rapaci 56 si veggion di qua sù per tutti i paschi: 57 o difesa di Dio, perché pur giaci?
58 Del sangue nostro Caorsini e Guaschi 59 s’apparecchian di bere: o buon principio, 60 a che vil fine convien che tu caschi!
61 Ma l’alta provedenza, che con Scipio 62 difese a Roma la gloria del mondo, 63 soccorrà tosto, sì com’ io concipio;
64 e tu, figliuol, che per lo mortal pondo 65 ancor giù tornerai, apri la bocca, 66 e non asconder quel ch’io non ascondo».
query.result:
**English:**
55 In the guise of rapacious wolves 56 they are seen from up here in all the pastures: 57 O defense of God, why do you remain silent?
58 Cahorsins and Gascons are preparing 59 to drink our blood: O good beginning, 60 to what vile end must you fall!
61 But the high providence, which with Scipio 62 defended Rome, the glory of the world, 63 will come to our aid soon, as I conceive;
64 and you, my son, who for the mortal burden 65 will return down there again, open your mouth, 66 and do not hide what I do not hide."
**Malay:**
55 Dalam rupa serigala buas yang rakus 56 mereka terlihat dari atas sini di semua padang rumput: 57 Wahai pembela Tuhan, mengapa Engkau tetap diam?
58 Orang-orang Cahorsin dan Gascon bersiap-siap 59 untuk meminum darah kita: Wahai awal yang baik, 60 kepada akhir yang hina apakah engkau harus jatuh!
61 Tetapi pemeliharaan ilahi yang tinggi, yang bersama Scipio 62 membela Roma, kemuliaan dunia, 63 akan segera datang membantu, sebagaimana yang aku pahami;
64 dan engkau, anakku, yang karena beban fana 65 akan kembali turun ke sana lagi, bukalah mulutmu, 66 dan jangan sembunyikan apa yang tidak aku sembunyikan."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
67 Sì come di vapor gelati fiocca 68 in giuso l’aere nostro, quando ’l corno 69 de la capra del ciel col sol si tocca,
70 in sù vid’ io così l’etera addorno 71 farsi e fioccar di vapor trïunfanti 72 che fatto avien con noi quivi soggiorno.
query.result:
**English:**
67 Just as flakes of frozen vapor 68 fall through our air below, when the horn 69 of the goat of heaven touches the sun,
70 so did I see the sky above 71 adorned and raining down flakes of triumphant vapors 72 that had made their dwelling here with us.
**Malay:**
67 Sama seperti kepingan wap beku 68 berjatuhan di udara kita di bawah, ketika tanduk 69 kambing langit bersentuhan dengan matahari,
70 di atas kulihat angkasa 71 dihiasi dan ditaburi kepingan uap kemenangan 72 yang telah membuat tempat tinggal mereka di sini bersama kita.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
73 Lo viso mio seguiva i suoi sembianti, 74 e seguì fin che ’l mezzo, per lo molto, 75 li tolse il trapassar del più avanti.
query.result:
**English:**
73 My gaze followed his appearance, 74 and followed until the middle, because of the multitude, 75 took away their passing any further.
**Malay:**
73 Pandanganku mengikuti penampilannya, 74 dan mengikuti hingga bagian tengah, karena banyaknya orang, 75 menghalangi mereka untuk melangkah lebih jauh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
76 Onde la donna, che mi vide assolto 77 de l’attendere in sù, mi disse: «Adima 78 il viso e guarda come tu se’ vòlto».
query.result:
**English:**
76 Where the woman, who saw me freed 77 from waiting above, said to me: "Turn 78 your face and see how you have been transformed."
**Malay:**
76 Di situ wanita itu, yang melihatku dibebaskan 77 dari penantian di atas, berkata kepadaku: "Putar 78 wajahmu dan lihatlah bagaimana dirimu telah diubah."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
85 E più mi fora discoverto il sito 86 di questa aiuola; ma ’l sol procedea 87 sotto i mie’ piedi un segno e più partito.
query.result:
**English:**
85 And the site of this flowerbed would have been more revealed to me, 86 but the sun was moving 87 beneath my feet, and its sign was divided into more parts.
**Malay:**
85 Dan lokasi hamparan bunga ini akan lebih terlihat olehku, 86 tetapi matahari bergerak 87 di bawah kakiku, dan tandanya terbagi menjadi lebih banyak bagian.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
88 La mente innamorata, che donnea 89 con la mia donna sempre, di ridure 90 ad essa li occhi più che mai ardea;
91 e se natura o arte fé pasture 92 da pigliare occhi, per aver la mente, 93 in carne umana o ne le sue pitture,
94 tutte adunate, parrebber nïente 95 ver’ lo piacer divin che mi refulse, 96 quando mi volsi al suo viso ridente.
query.result:
**English:**
88 The enamored mind, which my lady 89 always gives to me with my lady, to turn 90 my eyes to her more than ever burned;
91 and if nature or art made pastures 92 to capture eyes, to possess the mind, 93 in human flesh or in its paintings,
94 all gathered together, would seem as nothing 95 compared to the divine pleasure that shone on me, 96 when I turned to her smiling face.
**Malay:**
88 Pikiran yang sedang jatuh cinta, yang diberikan oleh kekasihku 89 selalu bersama kekasihku, untuk mengalihkan 90 pandanganku kepadanya lebih dari sebelumnya;
91 dan jika alam atau seni membuat padang rumput 92 untuk memikat mata, untuk memiliki pikiran, 93 dalam daging manusia atau dalam lukisannya,
94 semuanya berkumpul bersama, akan tampak seperti tidak ada apa-apanya 95 dibandingkan dengan kesenangan ilahi yang bersinar padaku, 96 ketika aku berpaling ke wajahnya yang tersenyum.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
97 E la virtù che lo sguardo m’indulse, 98 del bel nido di Leda mi divelse, 99 e nel ciel velocissimo m’impulse.
query.result:
**English:**
97 And the power that turned my gaze to her, 98 tore me from the beautiful nest of Leda, 99 and propelled me with great speed into the sky.
**Malay:**
97 Dan kuasa yang mengalihkan pandanganku padanya, 98 mencabutku dari sarang Leda yang indah, 99 dan mendorongku dengan kecepatan tinggi ke langit.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
100 Le parti sue vivissime ed eccelse 101 sì uniforme son, ch’i’ non so dire 102 qual Bëatrice per loco mi scelse.
query.result:
**English:**
100 Its living and lofty parts 101 are so uniform that I cannot say 102 why Beatrice chose me for that place.
**Malay:**
100 Bagian-bagiannya yang hidup dan tinggi 101 begitu seragam sehingga aku tidak tahu 102 mengapa Beatrice memilihku untuk tempat itu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
103 Ma ella, che vedëa ’l mio disire, 104 incominciò, ridendo tanto lieta, 105 che Dio parea nel suo volto gioire:
106 «La natura del mondo, che quïeta 107 il mezzo e tutto l’altro intorno move, 108 quinci comincia come da sua meta;
109 e questo cielo non ha altro dove 110 che la mente divina, in che s’accende 111 l’amor che ’l volge e la virtù ch’ei piove.
query.result:
**English:**
103 But she, who saw my desire, 104 began, laughing so joyously, 105 that God seemed to rejoice in her face:
106 “The nature of the world, which quiets 107 the center and moves all the rest around it, 108 begins here as from its goal;
109 and this heaven has no other where 110 than the divine mind, in which is kindled 111 the love that turns it and the virtue that it rains down.
**Malay:**
103 Tetapi dia, yang melihat keinginanku, 104 mulai, tertawa dengan sangat gembira, 105 sehingga Tuhan tampak bersukacita di wajahnya:
106 “Sifat dunia, yang menenangkan 107 pusat dan menggerakkan semua yang lain di sekitarnya, 108 dimulai di sini sebagai tujuannya;
109 dan surga ini tidak memiliki tempat lain 110 selain pikiran ilahi, di mana dinyalakan 111 cinta yang menggerakkannya dan kebajikan yang diturunkannya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
112 Luce e amor d’un cerchio lui comprende, 113 sì come questo li altri; e quel precinto 114 colui che ’l cinge solamente intende.
query.result:
**English:**
112 Light and love of a circle comprehend him, 113 just as this one does the others; and that boundary 114 only he who encircles it understands.
**Malay:**
112 Cahaya dan cinta dari sebuah lingkaran memahaminya, 113 sama seperti yang ini memahami yang lainnya; dan batas itu 114 hanya dia yang melingkarinya yang mengerti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
121 Oh cupidigia che i mortali affonde 122 sì sotto te, che nessuno ha podere 123 di trarre li occhi fuor de le tue onde!
124 Ben fiorisce ne li uomini il volere; 125 ma la pioggia continüa converte 126 in bozzacchioni le sosine vere.
query.result:
**English:**
121 Oh greed, that so drowns mortals 122 beneath you that none has the power 123 to draw his eyes away from your waves!
124 The will flourishes in men, 125 but the constant rain 126 turns true blossoms into worthless husks.
**Malay:**
121 Wahai ketamakan yang menenggelamkan manusia 122 di bawahmu, sehingga tidak seorang pun memiliki kekuatan 123 untuk menarik pandangan mereka dari ombakmu!
124 Keinginan memang berkembang pada manusia; 125 tetapi hujan yang terus-menerus mengubah 126 bunga-bunga sejati menjadi sekam yang tidak berharga.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
127 Fede e innocenza son reperte 128 solo ne’ parvoletti; poi ciascuna 129 pria fugge che le guance sian coperte.
query.result:
**English:**
127 Faith and innocence are found again 128 only in little children; then everyone 129 flees as soon as their cheeks are covered.
**Malay:**
127 Iman dan kepolosan ditemukan kembali 128 hanya pada anak-anak kecil; kemudian setiap orang 129 melarikan diri begitu pipi mereka tertutup.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
136 Così si fa la pelle bianca nera 137 nel primo aspetto de la bella figlia 138 di quel ch’apporta mane e lascia sera.
query.result:
**English:**
136 Thus the white skin becomes black 137 in the first appearance of the beautiful daughter 138 of him who brings morning and leaves evening.
**Malay:**
136 Begitulah kulit putih menjadi hitam 137 pada penampilan pertama putri cantik 138 dari dia yang membawa pagi dan meninggalkan petang.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
139 Tu, perché non ti facci maraviglia, 140 pensa che ’n terra non è chi governi; 141 onde sì svïa l’umana famiglia.
query.result:
**English:**
139 You, so that you may not marvel at this, 140 consider that there is no one who governs on earth; 141 whence the human family goes so astray.
**Malay:**
139 Kamu, supaya kamu tidak heran, 140 pikirkanlah bahwa di bumi tidak ada yang memerintah; 141 dari sanalah keluarga manusia menjadi sesat.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
142 Ma prima che gennaio tutto si sverni 143 per la centesma ch’è là giù negletta, 144 raggeran sì questi cerchi superni,
145 che la fortuna che tanto s’aspetta, 146 le poppe volgerà u’ son le prore, 147 sì che la classe correrà diretta;
148 e vero frutto verrà dopo ’l fiore».
query.result:
**English:**
142 But before January is all covered in snow, 143 because of the hundredth [coin] that is neglected down there, 144 these supernal circles will so revolve,
145 that Fortune, who is so much awaited, 146 will turn her stern where her prow is, 147 so that the fleet will run straight;
148 and true fruit will come after the flower.”
**Malay:**
142 Tetapi sebelum Januari semuanya tertutup salju, 143 karena seratus [koin] yang terabaikan di bawah sana, 144 lingkaran-lingkaran langit ini akan berputar,
145 sehingga Dewi Fortuna yang sangat dinantikan, 146 akan membelokkan buritannya ke tempat haluannya berada, 147 sehingga armada akan melaju lurus;
148 dan buah sejati akan datang setelah bunga.”
